text.section: A policy of health insurance may contain the following provision:

The policy provision set forth in subsection (a) of this section may be inserted only in a policy that the insured may continue in effect subject to its terms by the timely payment of premiums:
until the insured is at least 50 years old; or
if the policy is issued after the insured is 44 years old, for at least 5 years after its date of issue.

section.section:
Unless defined otherwise, "valid loss-of-time coverage" does not include:
coverage provided for the insured under a compulsory benefit statute, including a workers' compensation or employer's liability statute; or
coverage provided by union welfare plans or by employer or employee benefit organizations.
